title: 106_hr5469
content: The Act titled "Integrity of the United States Courts Act of 2000" allows for judicial review of binational panel decisions under the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act. The "Integrity of the United States Courts Act of 2000" allows for judicial review of binational panel decisions under the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act within 30 days after publication in the Federal Register. If a party alleges gross misconduct, bias, serious conflict of interest, departure from procedural rules, or exceeding of powers by the panel, they can seek review in the Court of International Trade. If a party believes that actions taken by a binational panel have materially affected the decision and compromised the review process, they can appeal to the United States Court of International Trade for a review. The Court will examine the legal and factual analysis of the panel's decision and determine if any misconduct has occurred. If so, the original decision will be vacated, and a new judgment will be entered. The Court of International Trade will affirm the original binational panel decision if actions are not established. Decisions made under this section are binding on the parties involved. Jurisdiction exclusively resides with the Court of International Trade for appeals related to goods from NAFTA countries subject to antidumping or countervailing duty determinations. The duty determination of a competent investigating authority in the United States is affirmed by the Court of International Trade. Jurisdiction for appeals related to goods from NAFTA countries subject to antidumping or countervailing duty determinations exclusively resides with the Court of International Trade. SEC. 3. JURISDICTION OF THE COURT OF INTERNATIONAL TRADE. Review of binational panel determinations. Section 516A of the Tariff Act of 1930 is amended to include provisions related to binational panel determinations under article 1904 of the NAFTA. Section 516A of the Tariff Act of 1930 is amended to include provisions related to binational panel determinations under article 1904 of the NAFTA, including a determination requested for review under section 404A of the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act. The amendments made by this Act apply to final determinations of binational panels under article 1904 of NAFTA published in the Federal Register after the enactment date of this Act.
